intro: Flueggea schuechiana, commonly known as the desert mistletoe, is a parasitic plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Phrymaceae and typically grows on the branches of other plants, deriving its nutrients from its host. The plant produces small, white or pale green flowers that bloom in late spring, followed by small, fleshy berries that are dispersed by birds. Its leaves are usually scale-like and closely arranged, reducing water loss in its harsh environment. Due to its parasitic nature and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its habitat.
